data.title: Unable to create Content Project
data.body:
![screenshot 2015-06-05 16 31 07](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/12015515/8008120/6e27d548-0ba0-11e5-8ab7-f7d262f79893.png)

Always when I try to create content project it only shows error (you can see it on the picture). I tried it with monogame 3.3, 3.4 and a development version after 3.4 (3.5.0.242).

data.title: [Gtk Pipeline] Implemented Drag & Drop from file manager
data.body:
Stuff done:
- implemented drag & drop from file manager
- merged addfiledialog and addfolderdialo into additemdialog
- fixed not being allowed to include files "Hello" and "hello" at the same time on Unix

data.title: README.md Roadmap implies Monogame is not at version 3 yet
data.body:
"MonoGame 3.0 will mark the start of full support for the entire XNA API."

MonoGame is currently at 3.4, so shouldn't that read: "MonoGame 3.0 **marked** the start of full support for the entire XNA API"?

data.title: [Gtk Pipeline] Fixed minimum size for Gtk3
data.body: Gtk 2 already has minimum size set.

data.title: [Gtk Pipeline] Project name in window title and headerbar for main window
Unclear how to build a spritefont when referencing documentation
data.body: Now that the Pipeline tool has been fully released, someone should add directions for compiling SpriteFonts, etc to the documentation, as it is very unclear. I tried selecting "new spritefont" then building, but it's missing what I assume to be a TTF file. Could this happen, or at a minimum instructions be posted here?

data.title: Deserialize empty string elements
data.body:
This fixes an issue where this will deserialize:

```
<Vector2Array />
```

But this will not:

```
<Vector2Array></Vector2Array>
```

data.title: [Gtk Pipeline] Better text strict list
data.body:
Talking about when creating new folder/new item.

Stuff done:
- Made not allowed list of characters instead of the allowed one
- Set platform specific lists
- Made error text have less alpha in Gtk 3.8 or later (around the same alpha as https://github.com/gnome-design-team/gnome-mockups/blob/master/nautilus/nautilus-next/create-folder-wires.png)

data.title: Reverting 9f6ab17
data.body:
Reverting https://github.com/cra0zy/MonoGame/commit/9f6ab1788c0a9c7119ea7006da1434bd35524a5b

Sometimes I forget why I do some stuff. I've setup copying of nvtt libs because even if config file specifies the nvtt lib, it can't specify the other libs(nvcore, nvimage, nvmath).

data.title: Fix for #3094
data.body: Looks like MacGamePlatform misses the Present overload and metrics will not recreated. I dont have Mac so I dont know perfectly will it works or not.

data.title: [MacOS]: GraphicsDevice.Metrics are not being reset.
data.body:
It looks like the Metrics values are not being reset between rendering presentation.  The only place I see the metrics being reset is here: https://github.com/mono/MonoGame/blob/develop/MonoGame.Framework/Graphics/GraphicsDevice.cs#L490 which MacOSX is not calling.

All other platforms seem to be ok so far.

data.title: Off thread game.Run() calls in Direct X result in broken keyboard input
data.body:
If you create a window on the UI thread on Direct X and then create another window on a different thread, keyboard input does not work. On Windows GL, the `game.Run()` call crashes because it isn't called on the UI thread.

I think a guard should be added to the game.Run() for Windows DirectX that throws an exception when that happens.

data.title: Spritefont Editor
data.body: I have the tool I wrote few years back that I am still using for editing spritefonts. Would it be of any use to add it here?

data.title: Warning Cleanup Part 1 of ???¿?
data.body: I've split up each warning fix into it's own commit for easier checking. Do say something if you want it rebased into one commit.

data.title: Removed WindowsGL and Linux target platforms
data.body: We really need to remove WindowsGL and Linux as target platforms, on Windows Pipeline Tool instead of property grid loading WindowsGL, Linux and DesktopGL names, it loads Linux name 3 times.

data.title: Need to build Android openal-soft for new 64bit Architectures
data.body:
Android now has a few of new architectures. x86_64, arm64-v8a to name two. 
We need to recompile the Native libraries for these new platforms.
It might also be handy to document how to do this, so that perhaps we can integrate it somehow into the build system so it doesn't have to be done manually in the future.

data.title: NVorbis Dispose fix
data.body: Fixes #3897

data.title: Windows OpenGL: NRE Crash when exiting application
data.body:
There is a NRE being generated when exiting a Windows OpenGL application.

NRE happening here: https://github.com/mono/MonoGame/blob/develop/MonoGame.Framework/Audio/OpenALSoundController.cs#L310

The lines causing the NRE are here : https://github.com/mono/MonoGame/blob/develop/MonoGame.Framework/Audio/OpenALSoundController.cs#L96-L104

What is happening is that when _device = Alc.OpenDevice(string.Empty); has error being created it returns with a false in the catch https://github.com/mono/MonoGame/blob/develop/MonoGame.Framework/Audio/OpenALSoundController.cs#L103 

which leaves the _oggstreamer variable null which then throws an NRE in the dispose: https://github.com/mono/MonoGame/blob/develop/MonoGame.Framework/Audio/OpenALSoundController.cs#L310

data.title: DesktopGL w/ services
data.body:
I'll squash all those fix commits (I just want to see if this builds successfully).

This is an alternate version of #3891

data.title: MonoGame on Web
data.body:
I've been thinking on doing some work on this, even tho there is base for JSIL I would like to think of other options as well. Current options on getting C# on Web are:
- JSIL  (may translate C# badly in some cases, but it does produce files runnable even from android)
- NaCl  (requires browser plugin, but will be more precise in running C# than JSIL)
- PNaCl  (Chrome only, no plugin required)

@tomspilman @KonajuGames @dellis1972 What are your thoughts on this?

data.title: [Gtk Pipeline] Set default buttons for dialogs
data.body: I'm so much of a perfectionist.... this is just a small tweak to highlight the default button for the dialogs.

data.title: Content Writer/Reader for ClipAnimation.
data.body:
A `ClipAnimation` usually contains a large collection of `Keyframes`. We can improve loading times significantly by no longer depend on `ReflectiveWriter<Keyframe>`.

The resulting XNB is smaller since there is no need to prefix each `Keyframe` record with Reader Type. We save a byte on each record.

data.title: Content pipeline VS integration
data.body: What´s the actual plan, road map, general idea? I´ve noticed you removed inbuilt content compiler one version ago and since then I must say shader development became bit difficult because of slowed down iteration. Is there any chance to be able build whole project including all content in near future? At least shaders, images are not so important as they do not change so often.

Linux solution is still generated, it contains content pipeline stuff.
